sentence.Network_en: I distinctly remember wishing I had not got involved.
sentence.Network_cn: 我清楚地记得希望自己没有被牵扯进去。

sentence.Network_en: However, many customers found the smell of this product distinctly off-putting.
sentence.Network_cn: 然而，很多顾客觉得该产品有一股异味，非常难闻。

sentence.Network_en: I distinctly heard the loudspeaker calling passengers for the Turin-Amsterdam flight.
sentence.Network_cn: 我清楚地听到扩音器里在请都灵至阿姆斯特丹航班的旅客登机。

When I mingled with other families I distinctly discerned how peculiarly fortunate my lot was ., 在我接触到别的一些家庭之后 , 我清楚地体会到自己可谓得天独厚的天之骄子.
are not only as low-priced as the goods of other markers , but they are distinctly superior in the following respects .它们不但和其它厂家的产品一样低廉，商务英语口语而且在以下几个方面有其独特的优越性。
历年考研阅读必备短语大集合... ... as we all know 众所周知 distinctly separate 泾渭分明 increasingly hostile 越来越敌对.

entry.tran: 有区别的;不同的;个别的
entry.def: If something is distinct from something else of the same type, it is different or separate from it.

example.ex: Engineering and technology are disciplines distinct from one another and from science...
example.tran: 工程学和工艺学互不相同，也有别于自然学科。

example.ex: This book is divided into two distinct parts.
example.tran: 这本书分为内容不同的两部分。

entry.def: If something is distinct, you can hear, see, or taste it clearly.

example.ex: ...to impart a distinct flavor with a minimum of cooking fat.
example.tran: 用最少量的食用油来调出一种独特的口味

entry.tran: 确定无疑的;确切的;清楚的
entry.def: If an idea, thought, or intention is distinct, it is clear and definite.

example.ex: Now that Tony was no longer present, there was a distinct change in her attitude...
example.tran: 由于托尼不在场了，她的态度有了明显的转变。

example.ex: I have distinct memories of him in his last years.
example.tran: 我清楚地记得他最后几年的情况。

entry.def: You can use distinct to emphasize that something is great enough in amount or degree to be noticeable or important.

example.ex: Being 6ft 3in tall has some distinct disadvantages!
example.tran: 身高6英尺3英寸有些明显的不便之处！

example.ex: Another Cup marathon between the two sides is now a distinct possibility.
example.tran: 双方很可能再进行一场马拉松式的优胜杯比赛。

entry.tran: 截然不同于;完全不同于;有区别于
entry.def: If you say that you are talking about one thing as distinct from another, you are indicating exactly which thing you mean.

example.ex: There's a lot of evidence that oily fish, as distinct from fatty meat, has a beneficial effect.
example.tran: 有许多证据表明油性鱼，与高脂肪肉不同，对人体有益。

means.word_mean: 1. clear to the mind; with distinct mental discernment;

sentences.sentence: "I could clearly see myself in his situation"

means.word_mean: 2. in a distinct and distinguishable manner;

sentences.sentence: "the subtleties of this distinctly British occasion"
"urbanization in Spain is distinctly correlated with a fall in reproductive rate"

auth_sentence.content: He answered me quite distinctly, 'It's nothing!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He answered me quite distinctly, 'It's nothing!

auth_sentence.content: Governing in this way would make him distinctly un-Rooseveltian.
auth_sentence.res_content: Governing in this way would make him distinctly un-Rooseveltian.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Governing in this way would make him distinctly un-Rooseveltian.

auth_sentence.content: His lyrics are often full of distinctly phallic fun.
auth_sentence.res_content: His lyrics are often full of distinctly phallic fun.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His lyrics are often full of distinctly phallic fun.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =prick,表示"刺,刺激"; 2. 引申为火焰

stems_affixes.value_cn: 清楚的,明显的;[from]截然不同的
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis分开+stinct刺,刺激→把刺分开→明显的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 特别的;有特色的;与众不同的
stems_affixes.word_buile: distinct[adj.清楚的,明显的;[from]截然不同的]+ive表形容词→adj.特别的;有特色的;与众不同的
instinct[n.本能,直觉,天性]+ive表形容词→adj.本能的
distinct清楚的,明显的+ly表副词→adv.清楚地, 显然

stems_affixes.value_cn: 区别,差别;级别;特性;声望;显赫
stems_affixes.word_buile: distinct[adj.清楚的,明显的;[from]截然不同的]+ion表名词→n.区别,差别;级别;特性;声望;显赫
in内+stinct刺,刺激→内在的刺激,本能
in内+stig=stinct刺,刺激+ate使……→刺激别人内部→煽动

sentences.en: I distinctly remember Jane saying that the show started at eight.
sentences.cn: 我清楚地记得简说演出8 点钟开始。

sentences.en: In the gathering gloom it was difficult to see anything distinctly.
sentences.cn: 在越来越暗的情况下,什么东西都看不清。

sentences.en: She was distinctly lukewarm about my idea.
sentences.cn: 她无疑对我的观点不感兴趣。
这间房子看上去确实眼熟。
